text: Wojciech Fangor (15 November 1922 â€“ 25 October 2015) was a Polish painter. He was one of the creators of the Polish School of Posters. == Biography == Wojciech Fangor had private tutors and studied in the Academy of Fine Arts in Warsaw. His first picture was the Korean Mother. He worked in the style of Socialist realism. He lived in Warsaw. In 1961, he moved to West Berlin. Then he lived in England and the United States till 1999. Fangor had his exhibition in Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum in New York in 1970. He died in Warsaw in 2015. == References == Category:1922 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Polish painters
title: Wojciech Fangor
